title: hackbloc

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: hackbloc
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Absolutely any and all files and materials regarding or referencing the hacker activist group known as "Hackbloc" which had a web presence at the url "https://www.hackbloc.org" or the authors of the hacker activist magazine "hack this zine" that occurred between October 23, 2003 and March 5th, 2012.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, emails, chat logs, etc.

Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency.

Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials. Please search all relevant indices and databases. An insufficient search would be one that does not check the various locations in which records on or relating to this individuals are stored.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cooper Quintin

title: Fullerton College and Fullerton Police Department DFR Program

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Fullerton College and Fullerton Police Department DFR Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Access to public records related to the collaboration between Fullerton College, the Fullerton Police Department (FPD), and Flying Lion, Inc. concerning the FPD’s Drone First Responder (DFR) trial program.

This request is prompted by a law enforcement bulletin obtained from the Fullerton Police Department through a separate PRA request, which indicates that Fullerton College collaborated with the FPD on the DFR program. The bulletin specifically mentions that this collaboration led to the use of the call sign "Hornets" in honor of the Fullerton College Hornets. A copy of this bulletin is enclosed for your reference.

Specifically, I am requesting the following records:

1. All communications (including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and meeting minutes) between Fullerton College and the Fullerton Police Department related to the DFR program, including any discussion of the use of the call sign "Hornets."

2. Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding between Fullerton College and the Fullerton Police Department and/or Flying Lion, Inc. pertaining to the DFR trial program.

3. Any documents, reports, or presentations prepared by Fullerton College for or in collaboration with the Fullerton Police Department and/or Flying Lion, Inc. regarding the DFR program.

4. Any internal communications or documents within Fullerton College that discuss or reference the college’s involvement in or support for the FPD’s DFR program.

If any records are withheld, please provide a detailed justification for each withheld record or portion thereof, including the specific exemption that you believe justifies the withholding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Johnston

title: Mental Health Diversion Dept. 60

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Mental Health Diversion Dept. 60
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all cases from January 1, 2019, through September 30, 2024,  in which The Honorable Judge Julianne Sylva denied a motion, petition, and/or application for mental health diversion, with a breakdown of each defendant's race, gender, ethnicity, and/or national origin.

As you may know, the California Public Records Act applies to all documents in the agency's possession, regardless of who authored them, and obliges you to respond to this request within 10 days if you can make a determination without having to review the records in question. In accordance with section 7922.000 of the California Public Records Act, if you claim that any portion of any record is exempt, please redact that portion of the record that you believe is exempt and provide both the statutory citation to any exemption you believe is applicable and the specific reasons for your conclusion that the redacted portion of the record is exempt from disclosure and produce the remainder of the record(s). If you claim that any of the requested records are not a public record, or you claim a privilege not to disclose any record, please respond by identifying any such records and explaining your claim that it is not a public record or why it is privileged or confidential or otherwise exempt, in accordance with section 7922.000. Please produce all records for which you do not claim an exemption or privilege. The California Public Records Act requires determination of whether these records may be disclosed, and specific reasons why any material requested, or portions thereof, are exempt from disclosure, within ten days from receipt of this request. See Cal. Gov’t Code section 7922.535. It also requires that you notify us of this determination and of the estimated date and time when the records will be produced. See id.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous Anon

title: Documentation Associated with Patient Refusal

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Documentation Associated with Patient Refusal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any documentation, memoranda, e-mails, letters related to refusing services to civilian patients seeking medical help in connection with "Havana Syndrome" or AHI (Anomalous Health Incidents) at University of Miami Medical Center, Department of Otolaryngology; specifically, seeking consultation with Michael E. Hoffer, M.D from January 1, 2021 til September 1, 2024. The documentation should include justification of patients' refusal.

An example of patient's refusal is presented in  the correspondence between the Hospital and the patient as below:

"From: UConnect Outreach <uhcoutreach@miami.edu>
Date: May 1, 2024 at 9:20:42 AM CDT
To: Patient'S Name and E-Mail Address are deducted
Cc: UConnect Outreach <uhcoutreach@miami.edu>
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Re: OAR - Name Reducted - Ear, Nose and Throat (Otolaryngology)

Dear Valued Patient,
 
Thank you for choosing the University of Miami UHealth System for your healthcare needs. Dr. Hoffer specializes in certain cases and will not be able to assist with your request. We do apologize for this inconvenience. 
 
Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at 305-243-3564, during our business hours, Monday through Friday, from 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM. Our representative will be glad to assist you.
 
Thank you again for choosing UHealth, and we look forward to serving you.
 
Best,
 
Erica Goree
Outreach Patient Services| UHealthConnect
University of Miami Health System | Miller School of Medicine
www.uhealthsystem.com"

Also, below is an example of correspondence between the hospital and the patient inquiring whether patient is a civilian or a government employee in connection with the above mentioned request:

"On Apr 30, 2024, at 8:39 AM, UConnect Outreach <uhcoutreach@miami.edu> wrote:

Dear Valued Patient,
 
Thank you for choosing the University of Miami UHealth System for your healthcare needs. We have received your online appointment request. We need a little information to better assist with your request. Are you a government employee? Feel free to respond to this email or contact us at 305-243-3564. Our team can assist you Monday through Friday from 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM.
 
 We appreciate your trust in us and look forward to providing you with exceptional care at UHealth.
 
 Regards,
 
Millie Escarmant
Outreach Patient Services| UHealthConnect
University of Miami Health System | Miller School of Medicine
www.uhealthsystem.com"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Leonid Ber

title: Kristoffer Kristofferson (June 22, 1936 – September 28, 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Kristoffer Kristofferson (June 22, 1936 – September 28, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into country musician Kristoffer Kristofferson (June 22, 1936 – September 28, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find a New York Times report on his death at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/29/obituaries/kris-kristofferson-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

files.title: Request Received Acknowledgement Letter
files.source: Federal Communications Commission, United States of America

communications.subject: FCC-FOIA-2024-0001080
communications.communication:
Mr. Moore-

Thank you for your recent Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking access to records at the Federal Communications Commission.  We have determined that the records you seek are not under the Commission's authority.  Therefore, we will not be able to process your request.

The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) is an independent United States government agency established by the Communications Act of 1934 to regulate interstate and international communications by radio, television, wire, satellite and cable.  The Commission's jurisdiction covers the 50 states, the District of Columbia, and U.S. possessions.

While we are not sure where you can find the records sought, we provide the following link to find contact information for other federal FOIA offices: https://www.foia.gov/#agency-search.
Thanks,
Benish

title: 2024 Squares and Streets Boston

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: 2024 Squares and Streets Boston
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

At a Department of Planning meeting on July 17, 2024 titled "Ideas Reception", the Department of Planning provided a document with recommendations for the development of Roslindale Square. On p. 21 of the document (https://www.bostonplans.org/getattachment/ca10621a-15ff-4a12-a5db-484eaea99ce9), the Planning Department states that, “The southeast side of Washington Street contains several smaller retail uses. As an entrance to the Square, this area should accommodate future higher density mixed-use and housing development as well as medium scale entertainment and recreation spaces.”

On September 10, 2024 at a zoom meeting, the Planning Department described that members of the community provided input for the above recommendation (at around the 1:00 mark on https://bpda.app.box.com/s/qdtbwmvof3xouptc4jso85qpkdh2ve8h).

We request all documents relating to the “community engagement to date” statement made by Planner Eileen Michaud. Documents should include but are not limited to reports, minutes, meeting notes, conversation notes, office hours notes, emails. Specifically, please include:

1. Feedback from Archdale Boston Housing Authority residents
2. One-on-one conversations with community members and organizations
3. Office hour conversations with community members and organizations
4. Visioning session community feedback
5. Spring Survey
6. Feedback at the Ideas reception
7. Analysis of community feedback
8. Analysis of existing conditions and use


Also, please provide

Copies of all communication about Squares and Streets, including email, between the Planning Department and WalkUP Roslindale members. WalkUP Roslindale members include but are not limited to Board of Director members: Ricardo Austrich, Lisa Beatman, Benjamin Bruno, Jason Bylsma, Devin Cole, Steven Gag, Elizabeth Graham-Meredith, James Gurrier, Adam Kessel, Nikki Kong, Matthew Lawlor, Sarah Kurpiel Lee, Margaux Leonard, Elvira Mora, Mandana Moshtaghi, Robert Orthman, Kathryn Ostrofsky, Courtney Pong, Adam Rogoff, Adam Shutes, Gregory Tobin, Muge Undemir, Alan Wright

Copies of all communication about Squares and Streets, including email, between the Planning Department and Abundant Housing members. Abundant Housing members include but are not limited to Elvira Mora,  Jesse Kanson-Benanav, Kassie Infante, Cheryl Daniel, Mike Kriesberg, Julia Davidovitz, Joyce Mandell, Beyazmin Jimenez
Copies of all communication about Squares and Streets, including email, between the Planning Department and Rozzidents for More Rozzidents members. Members including but not limited to Nate Snell, Basak Alkan, Andrew Murray, Meri Bond.
Copies of all communications about Squares and Streets with Boston District 5 City Councilor Enrique Pepen and Staff. Staff including but not limited to Dianna Bronchuk

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joan Davis

title: Hassan Nasrallah (31 August 1960 – 27 September 2024)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hassan Nasrallah (31 August 1960 – 27 September 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah (31 August 1960 – 27 September 2024). His name is written حسن نصر الله in Arabic. His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find a New York Times report on his death at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/28/world/middleeast/why-israel-assassinate-nasrallah.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

death at the following link:
https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/28/world/middleeast/why-israel-assassinate-
nasrallah.html Please conduct a search of the Central Records System,
including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the
Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR)
Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file
records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all
relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but
not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as
a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any
information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to
137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released
records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those
records while additional records are located and processed for release. If any
part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review
and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive
documents, as the FOIA requires. I request that I be properly classified as a
media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written
numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these
documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any
questions about my media status. The requested documents will be made
available to the general public, and this request is not being made for
commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if
you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.
I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if
available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated
cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this
request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Matthew
Petti

Supporting documentation

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2024) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2024

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2024) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2024
communications.communication:
09-27-2024

SHORELINE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2024) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2024

Via email:  public.records@ssd412.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2024 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2024.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2024 can be excluded from this request.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation or NEXT-REQUEST.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, or NEXT-REQUEST.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

*** FORWARD THIS PUBLIC  RECORDS REQUEST TO PUBLIC RECORDS OFFICER ***

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of
Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation or NEXT-REQUEST.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, or NEXT-REQUEST.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

*** FORWARD THIS PUBLIC  RECORDS REQUEST TO PUBLIC RECORDS OFFICER ***

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of
Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

RCW 42.56. 120 (2)(e). An agency cannot charge a "redaction fee" for the staff time necessary to prepare the records for inspection, for the copying required to redact records before they are inspected, or an archive fee for getting the records from off-site.

title: NSA support for 2015 film "Blackhat"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NSA support for 2015 film "Blackhat"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the National Security Agency (NSA) and the production of the 2015 movie "Blackhat," directed by Michael Mann and starring Chris Hemsworth. I request any and all documents pertaining to NSA involvement with the production of "Blackhat." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the NSA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Blackhat," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: The Rhode Island Ripper

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: The Rhode Island Ripper
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all records and investigative files mentioning Jeffrey S. Mailhot, also known as the "Rhode Island Ripper," who murdered three prostitutes in Woonsocket, Rhode Island, between 2003 and 2004. I'm specifically looking for investigative files related to the cases, and any other documents that are considered public -- and particularly those that were not previously released.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please search HQ records as well as ALL field offices and resident agencies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: FBI Report Regarding Attempted Bribery of Former Puerto Rico Governor Vázquez

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Report Regarding Attempted Bribery of Former Puerto Rico Governor Vázquez
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Court documents show that the FBI has an at least 16-page report concerning the attempted bribery of former Governor Wanda Vázquez Garced by Puerto Rican Elected Official 1 and Puerto Rican Elected Official 2. The court document alleges "Puerto Rican Elected Official 1 aimed to negotiate with Vázquez, recognizing that if Pierluisi’sappointment failed, she would be positioned to become governor." The court document also alleges that "Vázquez agreed to assist the FBI, starting by recording a conversation with , a Department of Justice contractor (“Contractor 1”), who had been approached by , Puerto Rican Elected Official 1’s cousin and a convicted felon, about arranging a meeting between Vázquez and Puerto Rican Elected Official 1 regarding the governorship." The document continues by saying that "under the FBI's guidance, Vázquez recorded several conversations."

According to the document, the FBI closed the investigation in November 2019, citing difficulties in arranging meetings with Vázquez after she became governor. I have attached the document in its entirety to this communication.You can find the document here: https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/64868850/677/united-states-v-vazquez-garced/

A news report revealed that Elected Official 1 and Elected Official 2 are former Senate President Thomas Rivera Schatz and Resident Commissioner Jenniffer González Colón. You can find the news report here: https://www.noticel.com/tribunales/ahora/top-stories/20240927/wanda-vazquez-grabo-a-rivera-schatz-y-a-gonzalez-colon-alegando-soborno-ante-fbi/

Therefore, I request the following documents:

1) The at least 16-page FBI report mentioned in both the court document and the news report in its entirety that mention an alleged "“a conspiracy between [Puerto Rican Elected Official 1] and [Puerto Rican Elected Official 2] of their intention of removing the [Governor Vázquez] so either [Puerto Rican Elected Official 1] or [Puerto Rican Elected Official 2] can become the governor.”

This request is for all records produced between January 1, 2019 and the time this request is processed.  In the event there are multiple records, please send them to me on a rolling basis.

Please do a search of main file records alongside cross-reference records and an ELSUR (electronic surveillance) records. Additionally, please search the Sentinel database, the Investigative Data Warehouse, and the Data Integration and Visualization System.

I respectfully request expedited processing for this FOIA request because of significant public interest and urgency. Jenniffer González Colón, one of the people reportedly mentioned in the FBI report, is currently Puerto Rico's Resident Commissioner and is running for Governor of Puerto Rico under the New Progressive Party. Similarly, Thomas Rivera Schatz, another person reportedly mentioned in the FBI report, is running for the Senate of Puerto Rico. The FBI report could have pertinent information relating to both of their campaigns, a highly relevant topic given the approaching November 5 election. Access to this information is crucial for informing the public about potential implications for governance and policy direction.

The information in the document is time-sensitive  given the November 5 election, which is less than 50 days away. There is significant public interest in the information within this report, given its relevance to current events and both politician's run for elected positions, which will impact voters and Puerto Rico public policy.

If any part of this request is denied, I would appreciate a detailed explanation for the denial, including the specific exemptions being claimed. Additionally, I would be grateful for your assistance in identifying any related documents that may exist.

title: KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – Communications submitted to the Kent School District Board of Directors (2024)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – Communications submitted to the Kent School District Board of Directors (2024)
communications.communication:
KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – Communications submitted to the Kent School District Board of Directors (2024)

Via email: PublicRecords@Kent.k12.wa.us

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.  Any/all emails sent to the Kent School District Board of Directors email address: kentboardmembers@kent.k12.wa.us

DATE RANGE FOR THIS REQUEST

January 1, 2024 - September 27, 2024

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION
If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: MBTA Draw 1 Cost Escalation (Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority (MBTA))

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: MBTA Draw 1 Cost Escalation (Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority (MBTA))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any responsive documents or reports written by MassDOT or MBTA employees or their Contractors that relate to cost and/or scope escalation between 2019 and 2024 for the project known as North Station Drawbridge Replacement, otherwise known as Draw 1 or Draw One. Specifically those pertaining to conditions, design decisions or other that resulted an increase in proposed project costs over that period from an initial estimate of $100m in 2019 (as evidenced in MBTA HS32PS01) to $571M in 2022 (FY23 CIP) and $1.1B in 2024 (FY25 CIP). 

Additionally all documents, drawings and other materials submitted to the United States Department of Transportation in support of the MBTA / MassDOTs most recent application to the MEGA grant program for the same Draw 1 project.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeffrey Lin

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Donovan Day, application fraud
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your FOIA request dated September 26, 2024.  Please find attached the documents responsive to your request.

To the extent you deem this request has been denied, you have a right to have your request and our response reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to:

Public Access Counselor / Office of the Attorney General
500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, Illinois 62701
Fax: 217.782.1396
E-Mail: public.access@ilag.gov<mailto:public.access@ilag.gov>

If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC.

You also have the right to seek judicial review of your request by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11.


Best regards.

Lou Leone

201 West Diggins Street
Harvard, Illinois 60033
